message.raw:
Fixed the bug where clicking a combobox (that has an associated model) would freeze the program.
It turns out that Bilbo had written a message handler to promote Qt Warnings to exceptions (in qtutils/__init__.py). Clicking a combobox with a model throws a Qt Warning "QAccessibleWidget::rect: This implementation does not support subelements! (ID 1 unknown for QWidget)" which we might want to fix later.
The message handler raised an exception, which never showed and locked up the application. Apparently you can't raise exceptions there (maybe it is a pyside bug, who knows!)
